solution.text:
\(\frac {AE}{EB} =\frac {Ah}{hC}\)
From the theorem that says If a line divides any two sides of a triangle in the same ratio, then the line is parallel to the third side
\(\Rightarrow \) EH is parallel to BC
\(\Rightarrow \angle AEF = \angle EBC\) (corresponding angles)
given that \(\angle AEF = \angle ACB \)
Therefore \(\angle EBC = \angle hCB \Rightarrow AB=AC\)
Hence \(\bigtriangleup\) ABC is an isosceles triangle.

content.text:
If \(\angle AEF = \angle ACB \) and \(\frac {AE}{EB} =\frac {Ah}{hC}\)
From the ones given below choose the correct options.

incorrect.text: \(\bigtriangleup \) ABC is not an isosceles triangle
